intro: Erysimum hedgeanum, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters along the stems. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Erysimum hedgeanum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
